item.title: Having Fun with R and Python
item.description: Introduction Python and R are both programming languages that are extremely useful for data wrangling and analysis, especially in the realm of computational biology and bioinformatics. Although many think of these different coding languages (or coding in general) as boring and difficult to understand, I decided to introduce a little bit of humor to showcase the fun side of coding below! R and Python I will be starting in R by assigning the follow string of characters to TheBestest

item.title: Project 1: Deaths from Measles and Whooping Cough in London
item.description: Adaylin Alvarez aa77336 0. Introduction: Write a narrative introductory paragraph or two describing the datasets you have chosen, the variables they contain, how they were acquired, and why they are interesting to you. Expand on potential associations you may expect, if any. library(DAAG) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) glimpse(whoops) ## Time-Series [1:142, 1:3] from 1740 to 1881: 280 100 122 92 46 135 95 151 150 82 ... ## - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 ## .

item.title: Project 2 Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: ## Adaylin Alvarez aa77336 0. Introduce your dataset and each of your variables (or just your main variables if you have lots) in a paragraph. What are they measuring?
